intro: Zeuxine boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands in Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features basal leaves that are palmately divided, and its stems are often hairy. Zeuxine boninensis is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
